result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Furtick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through.
Give DNA Sample.

Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission.

Defendant Justin D Furtick in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justin F. addresses the court. He was ordered to make payment(s) towards obtaining counsel. Per the court, that has not occurred. Atty. Niemi addresses the court. Cash bond requested at $1500.00. Court indicates when the bond $ is posted, that money can be applied to obtaining counsel. Justin F. addresses the court, he says he will enter a plea today if he won't go to jail. Court goes over the def.'s rights to a trial etc. Justin F. enters a plea of guilty to count 2. The court finds him guilty of count 2 and count 1 is dismissed but read in. The court then proceeds into sentencing.
letter from Judge Habeck to defendant, regarding Attorney deposits not made
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

For a plea to Count 2, DA will move to dismiss but read-in Count 1.  Defendant changes his mind and wants counsel.  Court wants money posted for a retainer then $750.00 by 7/19/16, $375.00 by 8/20/16 and 375.00 by 9/20/16.

Defendant Justin D Furtick in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant still wants counsel.  If Court will give him another month.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
AIA - June6, 2016 hand delivered in courtroom.

Defendant Justin D Furtick in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has about 1/2 of retainer needed to hire Dave Winter.  Court reminds DE of bond conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin D Furtick in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was injured at work, needs more time for counsel.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin D Furtick in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA makes 2 recommendations to the defendant, one for probation and one for straight jail.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
withdraw by Court

No violent contact with MH or her residence at 506 S Webb St Apt C in Wittenberg except only with law enforcement to remove some items.  Do not live together in the same residence.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

Defendant looking for an attorney.  Amended complaint from a felony to a misdemeanor.  Bond has already been set.  Reinstate the signature bond.  Cancel the bond forfeiture.  Conditions continue.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
